channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Glider crashes near Taupō
item.description: Two people are dead following a glider crash near Taupō this afternoon.

item.title: Work stint in the South Island inspires Aucklanders to relocate
item.description: Three generations of one whānau from Auckland working on the Kaikōura highway rebuild have decided to make the South Island home.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand for ninth straight day - Health Ministry
item.description: There are no new cases of Covid-19 today, and still just one active case, the Health Ministry has confirmed.

item.title: Severe weather to hit North Island, with more rain, strong winds predicted next week
item.description: Forecasted severe weather is moving south onto the upper North Island today, and it's predicted to bring with it heavy rain and gales.

item.title: Tarananki shaken by magnitude 4.9 earthquake
item.description: Thousands of New Zealanders have reported feeling the 4.9 earthquake that struck 35 km north of New Plymouth this afternoon.

item.title: Queens Birthday road toll rises to two
item.description: Two people have died after two separate crashes across the country this weekend.

item.title: Complex link between whales, krill and temperatures discovered
item.description: Researchers have found a complex link between blue whales in Taranaki, krill and ocean temperatures.

item.title: Warnings on freshwater rules were heard - Taranaki politician
item.description: Taranaki politician says new national freshwater rules show adaptations have been made after concerns were raised.

item.title: Gun fired at Levin house - police
item.description: Another property has been shot at in Levin, the latest in a string of shootings this year.

item.title: Many Covid-19 testing centres closing down
item.description: Dozens of Covid-19 community based testing centres around the country are closing down.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, still one active case
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand for the eighth straight day, with just one active case still remaining in New Zealand.

item.title: Domestic tourists get busy travelling New Zealand
item.description: Airports are busy around the country as people spread their wings after lockdown, for the long weekend.

item.title: Christchurch motorists warned of delays as new motorway sections open
item.description: Christchurch drivers are being warned to expect delays as people get used to new layout on the Christchurch Southern Motorway.

item.title: Appeal for witnesses after 82yo woman injured in street robbery
item.description: An 82-year-old woman has been robbed on central city street in Palmerston North today.

item.title: Severe weather warning for upper North Island
item.description: Heavy rain and possibly severe gales are set to hit the north of the country from tomorrow.

item.title: Asians reluctant to seek help for mental health reach out during pandemic
item.description: A charity offering mental health support to Asians says a sharp rise in those seeking help shows a long-term plan is needed to help those in need.

item.title: Report into troubled NZTA department withheld
item.description: The Transport Agency has refused to release an inquiry into potential conflicts of interest over high-tech contracts.

item.title: Police Eagle helicopters called out more than 16 times a day
item.description: Police are using the Eagle helicopters for an average of more than 16 incidents a day, at a cost to taxpayers of more than $2000 an hour.
